alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 28 at 8:27PM MST until July 28 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 930 PM MST. * At 827 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Boyce Thompson Arboretum to 10 miles east of Florence to 14 miles east of Coolidge Airport, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 176 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 173 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 187 and 225. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Superior, Gold Canyon, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, Gold Camp, and San Tan Village Mall. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
